alert.note: Alert for Big Hole Mountains; Blackfoot Mountains; Caribou Range; Eastern Magic Valley; Franklin, Eastern Oneida Region; Lower Snake River Plain; Marsh and Arbon Highlands; Raft River Region; Teton Valley (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 2:48PM MDT by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...A line of thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Teton, northern Caribou, north central Oneida, northeastern Bannock, central Power, eastern Bonneville and southeastern Bingham Counties through 330 PM MDT... At 244 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking multiple showers and thunderstorms near Portneuf Gap extending northeast to Driggs, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Moderate to heavy rainfall is likely. Some showers will move over the same areas creating a chance for flash flooding. Locations impacted include... Pocatello, American Falls, Driggs, McCammon, Swan Valley, Blackfoot Reservoir, Wayan, Neeley, Palisades Reservoir, Chesterfield Reservoir, American Falls Reservoir, Chubbuck, Victor, Inkom, Rockland, Irwin, Fort Hall Bannock Creek Lodge, Henry, Pocatello Airport and Fort Hall Putnam Lodge. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Do not drive through water on roadways.
